value.title: Architect full-stack applications and automate deployments with GitHub
value.excerpt: In the language of your choice (Node.js, Python, or .NET), deploy an end-to-end solution to solve the real-world scenario of catching the bus. You'll learn how to architect a solution that uses Azure SQL Database, Azure Functions, Azure Static Web Apps, Logic Apps, Visual Studio Code, and GitHub Actions.

value.title: Build a Node.js app for Azure Cosmos DB in Visual Studio Code
value.excerpt: Build a database app to store and query data in Azure Cosmos DB by using Visual Studio Code, Node.js and JavaScript.

value.title: Build a Java app for Azure Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: Learn how to create a Java application to store and query data in Azure Cosmos DB

value.title: Architect modern applications using Azure SQL Database
value.excerpt: Break down a scenario for an application and build a multi-service solution based on the microservices approach. Learn how to use modern database capabilities to build a foundation for applications.

value.title: Deploy serverless APIs with Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and Azure SQL Database
value.excerpt: In the language of your choice (Node.js, Python, or .NET), learn how to deploy an Azure Function that adds real-time data to an Azure SQL Database and triggers an Azure Logic App for notifications, all with GitHub Actions for CI/CD.

value.title: Design for availability and recoverability in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to handle infrastructure and service failure, recover from the loss if data, and recover from a disaster by designing availability and recoverability into your architecture.

images.title: Design for availability and recoverability in Azure
Design for availability and recoverability in Azure

value.title: Design for performance and scalability in Azure
value.excerpt: Scaling your system to handle load, identifying network bottlenecks, and optimizing your storage performance are important to ensure your users have the best experience. Learn how to make your application perform at its best.

images.title: Design for performance and scalability in Azure
Design for performance and scalability in Azure

value.title: Encrypt public sector data in Azure
value.excerpt: Overview of the options available for managing encryption keys and encrypting data throughout its lifecycle, with special attention to public sector.

value.title: Introduction to Azure Cache for Redis
value.excerpt: Evaluate how Azure Cache for Redis can improve the performance and scalability of your apps. Describe how Redis provides a critical low-latency and high-throughput data storage solution to modern apps.

value.title: Introduction to Azure Database for MariaDB
value.excerpt: Describe how Azure Database for MariaDB supports mission-critical workloads with predictable performance and dynamic scalability. Evaluate whether you can implement Azure Database for MariaDB to address your relational database needs.

value.title: Introduction to Azure Database for MySQL
value.excerpt: Describe how Azure Database for MySQL supports mission-critical workloads with predictable performance and dynamic scalability. Determine whether you should implement Azure Database for MySQL to address your relational database needs.

value.title: Introduction to Azure SQL Edge
value.excerpt: Azure SQL Edge is an optimized relational database engine geared for IoT and IoT Edge deployments. It provides capabilities to create a high-performance data storage and processing layer for IoT applications and solutions.

value.title: Use managed data stores in a cloud-native ASP.NET Core microservices app
value.excerpt: This module guides you through implementing Azure-managed data stores in an ASP.NET Core microservices app.

value.title: Use built-in functions and GROUP BY in Transact-SQL
value.excerpt: Use built-in functions and GROUP BY in Transact-SQL

value.title: Write Subqueries in T-SQL
value.excerpt: Write Subqueries in T-SQL

value.title: 5 Things you didn't know about Azure SQL Database | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, learn about 5 things you didn't know about Azure SQL Database.   For more tips and tricks, visit: https://aka.ms/azuretipsandtricks   Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. Create your free account today with Microsoft Azure: https://azure.com/free

value.title: An intro to Azure Cosmos DB JavaScript SDK 2.0 | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Chris Anderson joins Donovan Brown to discuss Azure Cosmos DB JavaScript SDK 2.0, which adds support for multi-region writes, a new fluent-style object model—making it easier to reference Azure Cosmos DB resources without an explicit URL—and support for promises and other modern JavaScript features.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/UkXsosjbWKA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: An intro to Azure Cosmos DB .NET SDK 3.0 | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Kirill Gavrylyuk joins Scott Hanselman to discuss new improvements for Azure Cosmos DB SDKs, including the new, idiomatic .NET SDK with friendlier, more intuitive programming model, better testability, better performance, .NET Standard 2.0 support, and now open sourced. [01:11] Demo Start   Azure Cosmos

value.title: Azure Cosmos DB Free Tier and Autopilot | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Kirill Gavrylyuk joins Scott Hanselman to go over two important updates to Azure Cosmos DB: Free Tier and Autopilot. value.title: Azure Cosmos DB update for August 2019 | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Azure Cosmos DB keeps getting better with a preview of notebook support, we've got Apache Spark, great new optimizations in queries, and idiomatic SDKs now on v3. value.title: Azure Friday | Apache Spark Connector for Azure Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: Emily Lawton stops by to chat with Scott Hanselman about the Azure Cosmos DB Spark Connector, which enables Azure Cosmos DB to act as an input source or output sink for Apache Spark jobs.  For more information, see:  Azure Cosmos DB Spark Wiki - https://github.com/azure/azure-cosmosdb-spark/wiki

value.excerpt: Azure Cosmos DB is a globally distributed database with limitless elastic scale. To take advantage of elastic scale, you first need to choose a partition key. value.title: Azure Friday | Azure SQL Data Warehouse compute optimized performance tier
value.excerpt: Ron Ortloff talks with Scott Hanselman about the new Azure SQL Data Warehouse compute optimized tier that enables you to analyze ever growing amounts of data more easily, and how the team used NVM Express caching for up to 100x better performance. value.excerpt: Veljko Vasic shows Seth Juarez how Azure SQL Database uses built-in intelligence to continuously monitors database usage so that it can detect disruptive events that cause poor performance. value.excerpt: Kirill Gavrylyuk shows Scott Hanselman an easy way to build planet-scale serverless apps in minutes using Azure Cosmos DB and Azure Functions. value.title: Azure Friday | Try Azure Cosmos DB for Free
value.excerpt: Kirill Gavrylyuk shows Scott Hanselman a new way to try Azure Cosmos DB free of charge, no sign-up or credit card required. It's a perfect way to get to know Azure Cosmos DB better, without commitment. For more information, see: https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/try/cosmosdb/
